availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky farmer. Married to Eliza Adams. Father of John Adams, Nancy G. Adams, Robert C. Adams, Patsy Adams, Sally Adams, Margaret Adams, Mary A. Adams, Florence Adams, and Rebecca Adams. Owned ten enslaved persons in 1850 and fourteen in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 18; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 2; "David Adams," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=89299852&ref=acom) (accessed on April 10, 2017).
